description: From Middle English perdurable, from Old French pardurable, from Medieval Latin perdūrābilis, from Latin perdurāre (“to endure”), from per- (“throughout”) + durare (“to last”).

adjectives.description: perdurable (comparative more perdurable, superlative most perdurable)

examples: In Paradyce, that place of pleaſure perdurableThe progeny of parrottis, were fayre and fauorable
